header_summary:
The recent release of Bitcoin Core version v30.2 introduces significant updates, including new features, bug fixes, performance enhancements, and expanded compatibility across operating systems such as Linux Kernel 3.17+, macOS 13+, and Windows 10+. This version, now available for download, addresses critical issues including wallet migration failures and improves upon various system components like the build and test suites. The development team, including Ava Chow, brunoerg, and others, encourages the community to report any issues via the project's GitHub page ([Bitcoin Core's website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-30.2/)).

A crucial bug fix in version 30.2 of Bitcoin Core corrects a previously identified problem where wallet migration could inadvertently delete all files in the wallet directory, potentially leading to fund loss. This issue, highlighted before the software update, emphasizes the importance of caution when migrating wallets and has led to the withdrawal of affected release binaries as a preventive measure ([GitHub issues](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues)).

The Hornet UTXO(1) database represents a breakthrough in Bitcoin client technology, offering highly parallel, lock-free consensus validation that drastically improves throughput. This development is part of the Hornet Node project, aimed at enhancing Bitcoin's efficiency. Its ability to revalidate the entire Bitcoin mainnet chain significantly faster than the current standard positions it as a notable advancement in blockchain technology ([Hornet Node project](https://hornetnode.org/paper.html)).

An analytical update on miner revenue changes linked to block propagation times within the Bitcoin network offers new insights into mining competitiveness. By adjusting the presentation of data to reflect proportional revenue changes among miners, the analysis provides a clearer understanding of how block propagation times impact mining efficiency. This refined approach, coupled with the code made publicly available for review, fosters greater transparency and collaboration in examining Bitcoin mining dynamics ([mining simulation project](https://github.com/darosior/miningsimulation/commit/bf828b34833b11d1181497b4e5f8b607b6acf309)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v30.2 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v30.2 is now available, featuring new updates, bug fixes, and performance improvements.
- Upgrading requires a complete shutdown of previous versions, with detailed instructions for all operating systems.
- The release includes significant changes in wallets, IPC, build system, testing, and documentation, supported on multiple OS.

recent_posts.title: Wallet Migration Failure May Delete Unrelated Wallet Files In Bitcoin Core 30.0 and 30.1
recent_posts.summary:
- A bug in Bitcoin Core versions 30.0 and 30.1 could delete wallet files, risking fund loss.
- Version 30.2 is planned to fix this, with current versions withdrawn as a precaution.
- Users are advised against wallet migrations until the release, impacting only certain conditions.

recent_posts.title: Hornet UTXO(1): A custom, constant-time, highly parallel UTXO database
recent_posts.summary:
- Hornet UTXO(1) significantly enhances Bitcoin consensus validation with its lock-free, concurrent design.
- It validated the entire mainnet chain in 15 minutes, outperforming Bitcoin Core's 167 minutes.
- The project, detailed in T. Sharp's paper, seeks community feedback and support for further development.

recent_posts.title: Propagation Delay and Mining Centralization: Modeling Stale Rates
recent_posts.summary:
- A blog post updated analysis on Bitcoin miner revenue and block propagation time.
- Adjustments provide insight on mining competitiveness via proportional revenue changes.
- Method and visual aids modified for clarity, details shared on GitHub.

recent_posts.title: What is the importance of running a node?
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses high bandwidth costs in blockchain operations, not storage costs.
- It explains the strain when many users depend on a single node for blockchain access.
- The message stresses distributing network participation to manage resources and ensure access.

active_posts.title: OP_CC: A simple introspection opcode to enable cheaper consolidations
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces OP_CHECKCONSOLIDATION to improve Bitcoin transaction efficiency.
- OP_CC reduces witness size for consolidated UTXO transactions by bypassing multiple signatures.
- This method promises a leaner blockchain and greater efficiency in transaction consolidation.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bitcoin Legal Defense Fund
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin developers confront lawsuits, prompting the creation of a legal defense fund.
- The fund aims to support developers with legal defense and strategy for Bitcoin-related projects.
- It's a voluntary, no-cost resource for developers, not currently seeking extra funds.

today_in_history_posts.title: [RFC] Lightning gossip alternative
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a v2 gossip protocol with x-only pubkeys and BIP-340 signatures.
- Weekly node_announcement_v2 relies on UTXO ownership for broadcasting rights; anti-spam measures included.
- Simplifies message exchange and introduces UTXO leasing and taproot_utxo_delegated_proof, leaving one issue unresolved.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive investments involve minimal management, while active ones require direct engagement.
- The dominance of passive investing poses risks like asset underutilization and potential market withdrawal impacts.
- Introducing an inflationary currency backed by a deflationary one could stabilize economies, albeit with implementation challenges.
